SEARCH
Package syspro.tm

Class WebServer

java.lang.Object
syspro.tm.WebServer
public final class WebServer extends Object
Dev Tools web server enables visual inspection of syntax trees to simplify debugging of your SysPro language implementation.
  1. Call start() at the beginning of your solution entry point (in your main method).
  2. Call waitForWebServerExit() at the end of your solution.
  3. Run your solution.
  4. Navigate to localhost:15412 with your browser.
  5. Choose the test and parser run you are interested in debugging.
  6. Expand the syntax tree as needed, examine diagnostics in more detail.

  • Field Details

    • DEFAULT_PORT

      public static final int DEFAULT_PORT
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Method Details

    • start

      public static void start(int port)
      Start a Dev Tools web server thread. Waits for the server to start, but doesn't block the current thread otherwise. You should use this overload only when there is a conflict for DEFAULT_PORT ownership.
      Parameters:
      port - Network port to bind the web server to.

    • start

      public static void start()
      Start a web server listening on the default port. Waits for the server to start, but doesn't block the current thread otherwise.
      See Also:
      • start(int)

    • waitForWebServerExit

      public static void waitForWebServerExit()
      Block the current thread indefinitely until web server has stopped. That happens when platform-specific "stop" signal is sent to the JVM. In IntelliJ IDEA that can be done by pressing the red rectangle in the "Run" pane.

    • waitForWebServerExit

      public static void waitForWebServerExit(long timeoutMillis)
      Block the current thread until web server has stopped or the time limit is exceeded.
      See Also:
      • waitForWebServerExit()

    • waitForWebServerExit

      public static void waitForWebServerExit(Duration timeout)
      Block the current thread until web server has stopped or the time limit is exceeded.
      See Also:
      • waitForWebServerExit()
